required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomised Trial Using Highly Purified Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (HP-hCG) and Recombinant Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (rhCG) in Women Undergoing Controlled Ovarian Stimulation
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Controlled, Assessor-blind, Parallel Groups, Multicentre Trial Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of Highly Purified Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (HP-hCG) and Recombinant Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (rhCG) for Triggering of Final Follicular Maturation in Women Undergoing Controlled Ovarian Stimulation

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is investigating the efficacy and safety of highly purified human chorionic gonadotropin (HP-hCG) and recombinant human chorionic gonadotropin (rhCG) for triggering of final follicular maturation in women undergoing controlled ovarian stimulation

primary_outcome.description: Oocyte retrieval took place 36 h (±2h) after hCG administration. At oocyte retrieval the number of oocytes retrieved was recorded.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to insemination (within 6 hours after oocyte retrieval)
secondary_outcome.description: Only applicable for insemination using intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI). The MII oocytes were counted prior to insemination.
Fertilization was assessed by counting the number of pronuclei, which was recorded as 0, 1, 2 or >2. Correct fertilization was defined as oocytes with 2PN.

secondary_outcome.measure: Positive β Unit of Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (βhCG) Rate
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as percentage of subjects with positive beta hCG. A positive β hCG was confirmed by a blood test obtained 13-15 days after transfer.
Defined as percentage of subjects with clinical pregnancy. Clinical pregnancy was defined as at least one gestational sac 5-6 weeks after transfer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: AEs were collected from signing informed consent until end of trial visit = maximum period approximately 5 months. However, only TEAEs are presented
secondary_outcome.description: The number of treatment-emergent AEs (TEAEs) in each treatment group will be presented.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: AEs were collected from signing informed consent until end of trial visit = maximum period approximately 5 months. However, only TEAEs are presented.
secondary_outcome.description: The intensity of an TEAE would be classified using the following 3-point scale: mild (awareness of signs or symptoms, but no disruption of usual activity), moderate (event sufficient to affect usual activity [disturbing]) or severe (inability to work or perform usual activities [unacceptable]).

arm_group.description: highly purified human chorionic gonadotropin, intramuscularly (IM)
highly purified human chorionic gonadotropin, subcutaneously (SC)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pre-menopausal females between the ages of 18 and 39 years
- Documented history of infertility
- Body mass index (BMI) between 17.5 and 32.0 kg/m2
- Regular menstrual cycles
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known endometriosis stage III and IV
- Known polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS)
- History of recurrent miscarriage
- History of more than three previous controlled ovarian stimulation cycles

facility.name: Instituto Ideia Fértil de Saúde Reproductive (there may be other sites in this country)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 4 sites in Brazil randomized subjects to the trial.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: In total 245 subjects were screened. Of these, 69 were screening failures and 176 were randomized. All randomized subjects were exposed to investigational medicinal product (IMP).

group.title: HP-hCG IM
group.description: Highly purified human chorionic gonadotropin 5000 international units (IU), intramuscularly (IM) Highly purified human chorionic gonadotropin

group.title: HP-hCG SC
group.description: Highly purified human chorionic gonadotropin, 5000 IU subcutaneously (SC) Highly purified human chorionic gonadotropin

group.title: rhCG SC
group.description: Recombinant human chorionic gonadotropin 250 µg SC Recombinant human chorionic gonadotropin

baseline.population: The intention to treat (ITT) analysis set was defined as all randomized subjects. Subjects were analyzed according to planned (randomized) treatment. All relevant baseline data were summarized based on the ITT analysis set. The ITT analysis set included all 176 randomized subjects.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Number of Oocytes Retrieved
outcome.description: Oocyte retrieval took place 36 h (±2h) after hCG administration. At oocyte retrieval the number of oocytes retrieved was recorded.
outcome.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as all randomized subjects. Subjects were analyzed according to planned (randomized) treatment.

group.title: rhCG SC

measure.title: Number of Oocytes Retrieved
measure.description: Oocyte retrieval took place 36 h (±2h) after hCG administration. At oocyte retrieval the number of oocytes retrieved was recorded.
measure.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as all randomized subjects. Subjects were analyzed according to planned (randomized) treatment.

analysis.groups_desc: Mean number of oocytes retrieved for the treatment comparison of HP-hCG IM versus rhCG SC
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Treatment comparisons were done in a sequential manner. First non-inferiority (NI) was tested for HP-hCG IM compared to rhCG SC (lower limit of the 95% confidence interval (CI) > -3.0). If NI was demonstrated, NI was also to be tested for HP-hCG SC compared to rhCG SC.
analysis.estimate_desc: ANOVA with treatment, stratum (<10 or ≥10 follicles with a diameter ≥12 mm), and site as fixed factors.

analysis.groups_desc: Mean number of oocytes retrieved for the treatment comparison of HP-hCG SC versus rhCG SC
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: As step 2 in the pre-specified sequential testing, NI was tested for HP-hCG SC compared to rhCG SC.
analysis.estimate_desc: ANOVA with treatment, stratum (<10 or ≥10 follicles with a diameter ≥12 mm), and site as fixed factors.

outcome.title: Number of Metaphase II (MII) Oocytes
outcome.description: Only applicable for insemination using intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI). The MII oocytes were counted prior to insemination.
outcome.time_frame: Prior to insemination (within 6 hours after oocyte retrieval)
outcome.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as all randomized subjects. Subjects were analyzed according to planned (randomized) treatment. Note that only subjects with ICSI were included in this analysis, i.e. 58 subjects in the HP-hCG IM group, 55 subjects in the HP-hCG SC group and 57 subjects in the rhCG SC group.

analysis.groups_desc: Number of MII oocytes retrieved for the treatment comparison of HP-hCG IM versus rhCG SC
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Pre-specified supportive endpoint analyzed in a similar manner as the primary endpoint.
analysis.estimate_desc: ANOVA with treatment, stratum (<10 or ≥10 follicles with a diameter ≥12 mm), and site as fixed factors.

analysis.groups_desc: Number of Mll oocytes retrieved for the treatment comparison of HP-hCG SC versus rhCG SC
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Pre-specified supportive endpoint analyzed in a similar manner as the primary endpoint.
analysis.estimate_desc: ANOVA with treatment, stratum (<10 or ≥10 follicles with a diameter ≥12 mm), and site as fixed factors.

outcome.population: The ITT analysis set was defined as all randomized subjects. Subjects were analyzed according to planned (randomized) treatment.

outcome.title: Frequency of Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: The number of treatment-emergent AEs (TEAEs) in each treatment group will be presented.
outcome.time_frame: AEs were collected from signing informed consent until end of trial visit = maximum period approximately 5 months. However, only TEAEs are presented
outcome.population: Safety was summarized based on the safety analysis set.The safety analysis set included all 176 subjects. Subjects were analyzed according to their actual treatment.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the Principal Investigator (PI) is that Sponsor can review the draft manuscript prior to publication and can request delay of publication where any contents are deemed patentable by the sponsor or confidential to the Sponsor. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the draft manuscript. Additional time may be required to allow Sponsor to seek patent protection of the invention.
